method.description: The authentication strategy used for all API endpoints

APIFile.description: API file configuration. Can be a path, an array of paths, a map of paths, or an advanced configuration

baseUrl.description: The base url for all API endpoints. If baseUrl is an array, it will enable for multiple base url options that the user can toggle.

inputPrefix.description: The default value that's designed to be a prefisx for the authentication input field. E.g. If an inputPrefix of AuthKey would inherit the default input result of the authentication field as AuthKey.

name.description: The name of the authentication parameter used in the API playground. If method is basic, the format should be [usernameName]:[passwordName]

example.description: Configurations for the auto-generated API request examples

languages.description: An array of strings that determine the order of the languages of the auto-generated request examples. You can either define custom languages utilizing x-codeSamples or use our default languages which include bash, python, javascript, php, go, java

colorScheme.description: The default color scheme to use.

fixed.description: If `true` then the banner will have fixed position (always visible).

breadcrumbs.description: If `true` then the breadcrumbs will be displayed.

sectionSeparator.description: If `true` then the section separator will be displayed.

buttonSize.description: The button size of the header.

externalArrow.description: If `true` then the header external links will display an external arrow.

separator.description: If `right` then separator will be displayed on the right side of the header.

header.description: If `true` then the logo will be displayed on the header.

sidebar.description: If `true` then the logo will be displayed on the sidebar.

fullWidth.description: If `true` then the search bar will be displayed as a full width.

middle.description: If `true` then the search bar will be displayed in the middle of the header.

right.description: If `true` then the search bar will be displayed on the right side of the header.

sidebar.description: If `true` then the search bar will be displayed on the sidebar.

externalArrow.description: If `true` then the sidebar will display a scroll shadow.

scrollShadow.description: If `true` then the sidebar will display a scroll shadow.

scrollTransition.description: The transition behaviour of the sidebar scroll when navigating to a new page.

scrollbar.description: The color of the sidebar scrollbar.

scrollbarColor.description: The color of the sidebar scrollbar.

surface.description: The tabs to display in the header.

Coder.description: Coder configuration for the theme, including options like syntax highlighting.

lines.description: If `true` then code blocks will have line numbers by default.

scroll.description: If `true` then code blocks will have a scrollbar by default.

dark.description: The dark color of the theme.

light.description: The light color of the theme.

primary.description: The primary color of the theme.

ComponentLike.description: A type that can be used to represent a component-like structure.

baseUrl.description: The base URL for the edit link

icon.description: The icon for the edit link

title.description: The title for the edit link

paths.description: Path aliases for imports. Avoid long relative paths by creating shortcuts.

store.description: If `true` then virtual pages will not created and generated content will be stored on disk

HeadConfig.description: Configuration type for head elements that can be added to the HTML head. Format: [tagName, attributes]

noprefix.description: Merge icons from the library into the default iconify library

contextStorageKey.description: Context storage key used to store the context in the browser storage

ariaLabel.description: The aria-label of the Github button

dataIcon.description: The data-icon of the Github button

dataShowCount.description: The data-show-count of the Github project

dataSize.description: The data-size of the Github button

href.description: The href of the Github project

label.description: The label of the Github Button

title.description: The title of the Github button

analytics.description: Configurations to add third-party analytics integrations. See full list of supported analytics here.

search.description: Configurations to add third-party search integrations. See full list of supported search here.

support.description: Configurations to add third-party support integrations.

props.description: The component's children, which can be a string, an array of strings, or an array of JSONComponent objects.

dark.description: Path to the logo in dark mode. For example: `/path/to/logo.svg`

href.description: External href to when clicking on the logo

light.description: Path to the logo in light mode. For example: `/path/to/logo.svg`

page.description: The page to link to when clicking on the logo

anchors.description: Anchors navigation - fixed navigation, for anchor-like elements.

segments.description: Segments navigation - navigation elements visible only on specific routes.

sidebar.description: Sidebar navigation - main navigation on the left side of the page.

sidebarDropdown.description: Sidebar dropdown navigation - navigation through dropdown in the sidebar.

href.description: The navigation href, if set it redirects but does not match based on routing

page.description: The navigation page, if set it redirects to the page + matches based on routing

href.description: The navigation href, if set it redirects but does not match based on routing

page.description: The navigation page, if set it redirects to the page + matches based on routing

href.description: The navigation href, if set it redirects but does not match based on routing

page.description: The navigation page, if set it redirects to the page + matches based on routing
The page to use for the page

templates.description: The template to use for the page

virtual.description: The virtual page to use for the page

anyOf.$comment: new (props: P, context: any) => Component<any, any>

React.JSXElementConstructor<any>.description:
Represents any user-defined component, either as a function or a class.

Similar to  {@link  ComponentType } , but without extra properties like  {@link  FunctionComponent.defaultProps defaultProps  } .

React.ReactElement.description:
Represents a JSX element.

Where  {@link  ReactNode }  represents everything that can be rendered, `ReactElement` only represents JSX.

React.ReactNode.description:
Represents all of the things React can render.

Where  {@link  ReactElement }  only represents JSX, `ReactNode` represents everything that can be rendered.

appearance.description: Appearance of this segment. If 'sidebarDropdown' then show this segment as a dropdown in the sidebar if match.

pages.description: The relative paths to the markdown files that will serve as pages. Note: groups are recursive, so to add a sub-folder add another group object in the page array.
Sidebar pages within this route or sub routes

Theme.description: Theme configuration that changes the look and feel of the project

coder.description: Coder configuration for the theme, including options like syntax highlighting.

favicon.description: Path to the favicon image. For example: /path/to/favicon.svg

logo.description: Path to logo image or object with path to "light" and "dark" mode logo images, and where the logo links to.

scripts.description: Custom scripts to be added to the head of the every page. Paths are relative to the root of the project or absolute.

desktop.description: If `true` then the item will be displayed on desktop.

float.description: Float the header to the right

href.description: The navigation href, if set it redirects but does not match based on routing

mobile.description: If `true` then the item will be displayed on mobile.

page.description: The navigation page, if set it redirects to the page + matches based on routing

props.description: The component's children, which can be a string, an array of strings, or an array of JSONComponent objects.

desktop.description: If `true` then the item will be displayed on desktop.

href.description: The navigation href, if set it redirects but does not match based on routing

mobile.description: If `true` then the item will be displayed on mobile.

page.description: The navigation page, if set it redirects to the page + matches based on routing

props.description: The component's children, which can be a string, an array of strings, or an array of JSONComponent objects.

maxTocDepth.description: The maximum number of table of contents levels.

description: Main settings interface for the application
